## Meeting Overview

This document presents three analyses:

1.  Sample consistency verification between non-jackknife and jackknife spending specifications
2.  Characterization of high predicted spending (blue-line) counties in Figure 2.3
3.  Cross-tabulation of baseline spending quartiles by predicted spending quartiles

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Sample Consistency: Jackknife vs Non-Jackknife

This analysis verifies whether the samples are identical between the non-jackknife spending charts (Figure 2.1) and the jackknife spending charts (Figure 2.4) from the 12/12 meeting.

### Key Findings

-   **Q0 (never-treated county-years) is identical** across both specifications
-   **Total observations unchanged** at 83,384
-   **Never-treated share remains 68.84%** in both cases
-   The two tables are built on the same set of county-years with identical treated vs. never-treated composition
-   Differences arise only **within the treated group**: counties are reassigned across predicted spending quartiles when moving from non-jackknife to jackknife

### Table 1. Predicted Spending Quartiles (No Jackknife)

``` stata
     pred_q |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------+-----------------------------------
          0 |     57,400       68.84       68.84
          1 |      6,104        7.32       76.16
          2 |      6,608        7.92       84.08
          3 |      6,664        7.99       92.08
          4 |      6,608        7.92      100.00
------------+-----------------------------------
      Total |     83,384      100.00
```

### Table 2. Predicted Spending Quartiles (Jackknife)

``` stata

------------+-----------------------------------
```

## Quartile Switching Analysis

Out of 464 ever-treated counties, **150 (32.33%) switch quartiles** after introducing the jackknife.

### Table 3. Quartile Switching Among Ever-Treated Counties

``` stata
   q_switch |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------+-----------------------------------
          0 |        314       67.67       67.67
          1 |        150       32.33      100.00
------------+-----------------------------------
      Total |        464      100.00
```

### Direction of Switching

No clear pattern in how counties move between quartiles. Switching is not systematically upward or downward.

#### Table 4. Direction of Quartile Switching (Non-Jackknife to Jackknife)

**Panel A. Counts**

|           | JK Q1 | JK Q2 | JK Q3 | JK Q4 | Total |
|-----------|-------|-------|-------|-------|-------|
| Q1        | 0     | 28    | 0     | 0     | 28    |
| Q2        | 48    | 0     | 0     | 16    | 64    |
| Q3        | 0     | 15    | 0     | 9     | 24    |
| Q4        | 0     | 13    | 21    | 0     | 34    |
| **Total** | 48    | 56    | 21    | 25    | 150   |

**Panel B. Row Percentages**

|           | JK Q1 | JK Q2  | JK Q3 | JK Q4 | Total  |
|-----------|-------|--------|-------|-------|--------|
| Q1        | 0.00  | 100.00 | 0.00  | 0.00  | 100.00 |
| Q2        | 75.00 | 0.00   | 0.00  | 25.00 | 100.00 |
| Q3        | 0.00  | 62.50  | 0.00  | 37.50 | 100.00 |
| Q4        | 0.00  | 38.24  | 61.76 | 0.00  | 100.00 |
| **Total** | 32.00 | 37.33  | 14.00 | 16.67 | 100.00 |

### Predicted Spending Changes

-   **Switchers**: Average change of −0.0019 in predicted spending relative to non-jackknife
-   **Non-switchers**: Essentially no change (+0.00001)

## Blue-Line Counties Analysis (Figure 2.3 Follow-Up)

This section characterizes counties in the Q4 (highest predicted spending) group from Figure 2.3.

### Baseline Spending

Blue-line counties are **disproportionately low-spending**. 47.32% fall into quantile 1 of baseline spending (pre_q = 1).

#### Table 5. Predicted Spending vs Baseline Expenditure

::: callout-note
Predicted spending quantiles are only defined among ever-treated counties.
:::

``` stata
   4 quantiles |
        of |             4 quantiles of exp
pred_spend |         1          2          3          4 |     Total
-----------+--------------------------------------------+----------
         1 |      5.04      25.21      33.61      36.13 |    100.00
         2 |     29.37      16.67      19.84      34.13 |    100.00
         3 |     21.50      41.12      29.91       7.48 |    100.00
         4 |     47.32      20.54      18.75      13.39 |    100.00
-----------+--------------------------------------------+----------
```

### Income Distribution

Blue-line counties are **spread across the income distribution** rather than concentrated in a single income quantile:

-   Q1: 27.68%
-   Q2: 16.07%
-   Q3: 34.82%
-   Q4: 21.43%

#### Table 6. Predicted Spending vs Median Family Income

``` stata
         4 |
 quantiles |
        of |         4 quantiles of median family income
pred_spend |         1          2          3          4 |     Total
-----------+--------------------------------------------+----------
         1 |     18.49      17.65      20.17      43.70 |    100.00
         2 |      9.52      19.84      26.19      44.44 |    100.00
         3 |     32.71      33.64      25.23       8.41 |    100.00
         4 |     27.68      16.07      34.82      21.43 |    100.00
-----------+--------------------------------------------+----------
```

### State Composition

Blue-line counties are **geographically concentrated**. Alabama alone accounts for 44.64%. Of the 15 treated states in the balanced panel, 10 appear in the blue line.

## Baseline vs Predicted Spending Cross-Tabulation

This analysis examines how baseline spending quartiles map to predicted spending quartiles.

::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"}
-   If all rows are missing for a state, that state is never treated and therefore does not receive a predicted spending quartile.
-   If some rows are populated and others are missing, the state does not have enough counties in the balanced sample to form four quartiles (e.g., Arizona has only one county).
:::

### Table 8. Mean Baseline Expenditure by Predicted Spending Quartile

| 4 quantiles of exp | Mean     |
|--------------------|----------|
| 1                  | 2.94958  |
| 2                  | 3.601695 |
| 3                  | 1.864407 |
| 4                  | 1.256881 |
| **Total**          | 2.44181  |

### Table 9. Baseline Spending Quartile by State (pre_q × State)

| pre_q | AL | AZ | AR | CO | DE | FL | GA | ID | IL | IN | IA | KY | LA | ME | MA | MI | MN | MS | MO | MT | NE | NV | NH | NM | ND | OH | OK | PA | RI | SD | TN | TX | UT | VT |

| 1 | 2 | 3 | 3 | . | . | . | 3 | . | . | 3 | . | . | 4 | 3 | . | . | 3 | 3 | . | . | 3 | 4 | . | 3 | . | . | . | 3 | 3 | . | 3 | . | . | 3 |
| 2 | 2 | . | 4 | . | . | . | 4 | . | . | 4 | . | . | 4 | 4 | . | . | 4 | 3 | . | . | 4 | 4 | . | 3 | . | . | . | . | 4 | . | . | . | 3 | . |
| 3 | 1 | . | 2 | . | . | . | 2 | . | . | 2 | . | . | 2 | 1 | . | . | 2 | 2 | . | . | 2 | 2 | . | 1 | . | . | . | 2 | 4 | . | . | 2 | . | 2 |
| 4 | 1 | . | 1 | . | . | . | 1 | . | . | 1 | . | . | 1 | 1 | . | . | 1 | . | . | . | 1 | 1 | . | 2 | . | . | . | . | 2 | . | . | . | . | 1 |

### Key Pattern

Quartiles 1 and 2 of baseline spending tend to go to **higher** quartiles of predicted spending, while quartiles 3 and 4 tend to go to **lower** quartiles of predicted spending. This pattern is consistent with mean reversion in spending predictions.
